div.div: Πάρις : Paris, son of Priam, who by the help of Aphrodīte carried off Helen from Sparta and thus brought on the war with Troy, Il. 24.28 ff. The name Paris is supposed to mean ‘Fighter’ (rendered in the Greek Ἀλέξανδρος), and he is represented by Homer as not without warlike prowess, though naturally uxorious and averse to fighting, Il. 3.39 ff, Il. 6.350.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
